summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Corporation, demanding telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies, and includes a request for confidentiality. It is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the demand for records from AT&T.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for AT&T
events.description: The date by which AT&T Corporation is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested telephone records.

events.title: Start Date for Requested Records
events.description: The subpoena requests all documents from this date forward, indicating the investigation is focused on activity from this period.

locations: National Compliance Center AT&T Corporation, 11760 U.S. Highway 1 North Palm Beach, FL 33408
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to AT&T on August 11, 2019, demanding extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward.

The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies, specifically potential violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, and 1519 (conspiracy, false statements, and destruction of records).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested AT&T voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The requested records include subscriber info, billing info, call details, text message logs, and device identifiers, indicating a broad investigation into communications.
The document is signed by Geoffrey S. Berman, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
